text: Great lineup of women investors in Silicon Valley: http://t.co/cM209QRL (H/T @christine)
Odd fact: White/Asian newlyweds have the highest income: http://t.co/iL1b2ZW8 > Followed by Asian/Asian, White/Hispanic.
@jeff @davemcclure Good point, I'll amend the event to make it clear that angels have *up to* 5 minutes, but can finish early.
@joshu @jeff If anyone needs to worry about imposter syndrome, it's me. Fortunately, I get to hide behind my role as moderator.
If any luminaries like @joshu are worried about presenting at #ReverseDemoDay, @jeff will present for them!
@dshen You were definitely the first to call it my best ever. I'm partial to my post on "The Meaning of Life" http://t.co/2aYgXOqV
My #JeremyLin essay is being reprinted in @PEHub: http://t.co/zUW38AjR > #Linsanity reigns supreme!
Apple sold 156 million iOS devices in 2011. It's sold 122 million Macs all time: http://t.co/4r9XinEE > Yep, it's a #postpcworld
Want to support #ReverseDemoDay? Upvote it on HackerNews: http://t.co/mV5QEkJO > This time, angels pitch entrepreneurs!
Free Event: "Reverse Demo Day" (9 am Feb 23) http://t.co/IHexcKSC > See @jeff, @davemcclure & other angels pitch themselves to startups.
As a loyal #WagesofWins reader and podcast listener, I'm honored to hear from you @NerdNumbers. You guys changed how I look at basketball.
Crazy business idea of the day: "The AirBnB of wineries." I wouldn't want to own one, but I might want to play Mondavi for a day.
Wow, @JamesFallows linked to my #JeremyLin post on #TheAtlantic. My life is now complete: http://t.co/CFAVrA6n > Kidding. Sort of.
Thanks to @Kazanju & @profsamuels_nyu for catching typos in my Jeremy Lin/Stereotyping post: http://t.co/mG3G4RnY

Blogged: "Jeremy Lin, Women in VC, and the Bigotry of Pattern Matching." http://t.co/mG3G4RnY > On prejudice in Silicon Valley
Blogged: "Serious About #Collaboration? Jobs Should Be At Stake." http://t.co/QGpBAlRT > How @McCannErickson sent a message to its staff.
In 2010, this draft analyst called @JLin7 the 2nd-best PG in the draft, after John Wall: http://t.co/Aaq4PgP6 > #Linsanity's prophet?
Happy Birthday to my teacher, IDEO founder David Kelley. #dkbday > Long may his mustache reign!
Blogged: "What Intelligence Tests Miss (is Wisdom)" http://t.co/qokxkIzn > Nuance usually comes with age.
"School asks students to be good at a range of subjects; life asks people to find one passion they will follow forever." (@DavidBrooksNYT)
Stanford raised $6.2 billion from 166,000 donors, or $37K/donor: http://t.co/GxLF0fXg > Phil Knight's $105 million raises the average!
When buzzwords go bad: I just an email ad for "cloud recruiting." Still trying to figure out what that means.
Ran into @ccarfi and son at Palo Alto food truck night, then saw @enochchoi win a free ice cream with his karaoke singing.
For those who are asking (@shinypb, @rexdixon), I started the day with 939 emails in my inbox, so cracking 200 is real progress.
Inbox just cracked the 200 barrier. Progress! Onwards!
@whitneyhess It was my pleasure to shine the light on a well-researched piece on VC gender balance.
#VC firm with the best gender balance? Kleiner (23% female). Majority of top-tier firms have 0 women investors: http://t.co/p64lCXr5
@jimbomorrison I used to use Priority Inbox, but gave it up.
Let's try this again. Current inbox = 939 emails. See you at the end of the day!
I was able to pull 400 messages out of my inbox today...unfortunately, another 200 or so arrived. Current count: 801.
The Knicks have a starting backcourt from Harvard (@JLin7) and Stanford (@LandryFields). (H/T @rickyyean)
#Socialmedia explained in terms of donuts: http://t.co/tKQxZ2O5 > This is screamingly funny.
Dear world: I have 976 messages in my inbox. Today is an email day. Please don't bring up anything new. Thanks!
Thank you all who donated to @Cycle4Survival! I raised $2K & the event set a new record of $6.1 million: http://t.co/TBup1om0
Please RT: Last day to donate $20 to fighting cancer & get an appointment on my schedule: http://t.co/agAuxwJg
SAVE HACKER DOJO - We need your support today.  http://t.co/6sW8fEbr Please RT.
Heard @DaveKrumholtz on @KevinPollak's podcast talking about his cancer; my old childhood friend Mike Yeh (no relation) was his surgeon.
Blogged: "Sleep Deprivation = Drunkenness" http://t.co/T4VIhOYx > Losing 1 night's sleep = being legally drunk.
Playing with #JustGobble on my iPod. Free streaming music via Youtube: http://t.co/bgMN6bph > Audio surprisingly good.
Facebook lottery! I accept friends from "People You May Know" until all 5 slots contain strangers. Avg score = 7 friends
@tjkeitt My 1986 self is wondering what "webisodes" are, and how he can watch them on his Apple ]['s green screen.
Blogged: The Evolution of Advertising (1999-2012) http://t.co/llbCnRTn > How your 1999 self wouldn't recognize today's world.

The great @WendySLea (CEO of @GetSatisfaction) now has an Inc column: http://t.co/RINyslkb > Added to my list of reads!
Congrats to @georgezachary & @davemcclure for topping @TheFunded's #VC rankings. Popularity contests can lie, but not this time.
"I am a lousy copywriter, but I am a good editor." http://t.co/6lm9gkB8 > Brilliant letter on ads (applies to all writing) from David Ogilvy
@LarsLeckie And 27% churn includes all contacts. If limited to just contacts in Silicon Valley, I bet the % would be higher.
343 of my #LinkedIn connections changed jobs this year. Since I have 1,389 connections, that implies 25% yearly churn.
Blogged: "Branding -> Accomplishment -> Ability" http://t.co/2gP2x66V > On YC hires & when sales/mkt/xp still matters.

Blogged: "How Many Windows Do You Need?" http://t.co/Qd50VK05 > On swivel-chair integration & #collaboration suites. #e20
This time-lapse video of Yosemite is stunning: http://t.co/n7earFg3 > I couldn't tear myself away.
My friend @puls points out that I'm complaining about virus DMs, not spam. Though I hate that too.
I hate Twittter spam. The latest are DMs that claim people are talking trash about me online. How are these accounts getting compromised?
Unemployment & avg salary for recent grads by major: http://t.co/aEbVGs2P > 11%/$30K for Arts, 7%/$55K for Engineering
Last chance! Donate to fight cancer & I'll meet with you: http://t.co/agAuxwJg > Donations b4 Sunday will be matched/doubled.
For the first time, US online ad spending exceeds print advertising: http://t.co/T1lctx6f > Next, TV! (a few years off)
Really impressed by how quickly @newsdotme swooped in to grab @Summify's old users. And the signup is super easy.

Great/scary @NYTimes infographic on "the 1%": http://t.co/RGzxd1aU > 27% of doctors, 15% of lawyers, 1% of engineers qualify.
#Stanford Engineering alumni have started 10,900 companies. There are just over 53,000 living alums.
Will go offline for a bit...we get to see an *unreleased* Pixar movie, but I have to check in all my electronics first.
Impressed with @gurusingh's incredible stage presence. This is a man who knows how to command an audience. #theXEvent12
"While we're here today, 27,000 children will die from starvation. 13,000 will die from a lack of clean water." --@gurusingh #theXEvent12
Notes from Embracing Entrepreneurship @ The Intersection: http://t.co/bQR1hVif (w/ @leila_c & @PayamZamani) #theXEvent12
"I met a Sudanese boy in a refugee camp. A month later, he friended me on Facebook." --@leila_c #theXEvent12 > Tech gives people voice.
"The fundamental thing that leads to #innovation is not accepting the status quo." --@leila_c #theXEvent12
"The best ideas that really changed our business came from outside, not from sitting in our own cocoon." --@PayamZamani #theXEvent12
@patriciashores Wish you could be here with me & @medicieffect (Frans)! You'd enjoy the day, and Pixar HQ is really cool.
#Pixar, #IDEO, & Innovation: http://t.co/HPHMe8EO > Nearly live notes & quotes from Ed Catmull & Tim Brown from #theXEvent12.
"We (Pixar) bet on the person, not the idea. We never start with the idea." --Ed Catmull #theXEvent12
Great #SteveJobs fact: He didn't attend story meetings at #Pixar because he knew his words would carry *too much* weight.
"We (Pixar) have had films that failed. We didn't release them." --Ed Catmull #theXEvent12 > Up was originally about a floating castle
"We like ideas that are unlikely. Because they're unlikely, we have to protect them." Ed Catmull, Pixar #theXEvent12
Here's Pixar's wall o' Oscars. Pretty impressive. http://t.co/5LecYghu
At the Pixar campus for the Intersection Event. http://t.co/31CZcARC
